PlantForm: Thorny densely-branched shrub or small tree.
Stem: Young stems zig-zagging with single curved thorn at each joint, mature stems woody and fibrous.
Flowers: Small, inconspicuous greenish white, unpleasant smelling.
FruitSeeds: Cherry sized 2-5 cm diameter, pale yellow to reddish orange when ripe, look like little apples.
Habitat: Floodplains, watercourses, roadsides, disturbed sites, pastures, open woodland.
DistinguishingFeatures: Larger fruit than other Ziziphus species, fruits are fleshy rather than hard shelled in Strychnine tree.
